alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Graham; Norton; Rawlins; Sheridan; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 20 at 3:34AM CST until December 23 at 6:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, snow and significant blowing snow. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Kansas and southwest Nebraska. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday evening through Friday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday evening through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Life threatening cold conditions will persist for nearly 36 hours. Snow and blowing snow will likely create near blizzard conditions Wednesday night causing travel to be very hazardous. Road closures are possible.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
